description: Unique identifier for the guarantee, often a reference number or contract reference.
The main subject of the guarantee, e.g., project, contract, or obligation.
When the guarantee becomes effective, such as upon payment or contract signing.
Expiry of the guarantee, fixed or conditional.
How a claim can be submitted: written form, with documents, within time, etc.
Legal jurisdiction or governing law of the guarantee.
If the guarantee must be returned or marked as complete at expiry.
Whether obligation is conditional or unconditional.
Can the guarantee be transferred or assigned to others?
